entries.english: Africans start the day at 7am = thaa îmwe cia rũciũ-inĩ (hour 1, not 7), ending at 6pm = thaa ikũmi na igĩrĩ/thinacara (hour 12, not 6). Night starts at 7pm = thaa îmwe cia hũaĩ-inĩ (hour 1 of night, not 7)
entries.kikuyu: Time System - African vs Western Hours

entries.english: Future negative pattern: Ndi-/Tũtĩ-/Ndũ-/Mũtĩ-/Nda-/Matĩ- + verb. Examples: Ndigũkwĩra (I will not tell you), Tũtĩkwaria (we will not speak), Ndũkwaria (you will not speak), Mũtĩkwaria (you all will not speak), Moiga matĩkwaria (they said they will not speak). Present negative: Ndiaragia (I don't speak), Ndaragia (he/she doesn't speak), Tũtĩaragia (we don't speak)
